channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Macy's employee who hid $151 million in delivery expenses was trying to mask initial mistake, sources say
item.description: The department store operator slightly raised its full-year forecast, while still projecting a sales decline.

item.title: Activist Starboard Value Takes Stake in Bitcoin-Mining Company Riot
item.description: Starboard wants Riot to convert some of its bitcoin-mining facilities into space for big data-center users.

item.title: Gold Falls After U.S. PPI Data, Jobless Claims
item.description: Gold prices extended losses after a measure of wholesale prices in the U.S. rose more than expected in November, while jobless claims increased to the...

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Rises as Inventories Shrink More Than Expected
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures gained after an EIA report showed that inventories had the biggest weekly withdrawal since January.

item.title: Oracle shares slide on earnings and revenue miss, disappointing forecast
item.description: Oracle shares fell Tuesday morning after the database software company issued disappointing quarterly results.

item.title: Treasury Yields Decline on Jobs, Inflation Data
item.description: Treasury yields fell as U.S. initial jobless claims rose more than expected last week.

item.title: Oracle shares suffer steepest drop of 2024 after earnings miss
item.description: Oracle shares fell on Tuesday following disappointing quarterly results from the database software company.

item.title: Ulta Beauty shares pop as retailer beats earnings expectations despite demand fears
item.description: The retailer hiked its full-year outlook slightly to reflect the better-than-expected results.

item.title: Lululemon stock jumps as international growth helps to offset slowing U.S. sales
item.description: Lululemon has been in a bit of a rough spot after the departure of its longtime Chief Product Officer Sun Choe.

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Fall and Trump Rings NYSE Bell
item.description: U.S. stock indexes were mostly lower after President-elect Donald Trump rang the opening bell at the New York Stock Exchange.
